intro: Prosthechea bueraremensis, commonly known as the Bueraremen orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the tropical regions of Central America. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and dense clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its leaves are linear and arranged in two rows along the stem. Prosthechea bueraremensis is notable for its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
